I2.2.1_funding_activity.name: Funding Activity
I2.2.1_funding_activity.interpretation: Limited investor interest - <5 rounds indicate quiet market

I2.2.2_total_capital.name: Total Capital Deployed
I2.2.2_total_capital.interpretation: Significant capital deployment - venture-scale funding available (but 97% from single Careem mega-round)

I2.2.3_investor_quality.name: Investor Quality
I2.2.3_investor_quality.interpretation: Limited institutional validation - no tier-1 VCs active

I2.2.4_funding_momentum.name: Funding Momentum
I2.2.4_funding_momentum.quarterly_trend: Highly volatile with alternating zero-activity quarters

I2.2.5_median_round_size.name: Median Round Size
I2.2.5_median_round_size.interpretation: Venture-scale rounds - median ≥$5M indicates growth-stage funding

I2.2.6_recent_activity.name: Recent Activity (Last 6 Months)
I2.2.6_recent_activity.interpretation: Quiet market - 0 rounds in last 6 months indicate cooling interest

I2.2.7_investor_diversity.name: Investor Diversity
I2.2.7_investor_diversity.interpretation: Broad investor interest - ≥5 investors indicate diverse validation

decision.rationale: Only 1 of 4 primary KPIs passes. Zero tier-1 VCs active. Funding momentum declining -91.75% YoY. Total capital appears strong ($413M) but 97% from single Careem mega-round masks underlying market stagnation with only $13M deployed to independent startups in 24 months.

implications.fundraising: VERY CHALLENGING - Traditional VC fundraising effectively frozen. Alternative pathways required: strategic partnerships (InDrive/Yango), accelerator validation (Y Combinator), Pakistan-focused VCs. Expect 12-18 month cycles with profitability-first requirements.
implications.market_timing: EARLY RECOVERY / HIGH RISK - Market under-capitalized relative to opportunity. Entry now allows asset-light differentiation while competitors remain capital-constrained. Post-crash recovery phase with subdued investor appetite.
implications.competitive_dynamics: MIXED - Corporate players (Foodpanda $10B+ parent) dominate but independent competitors limited (Krave Mart $16M only). Capital scarcity favors asset-light models over dark stores.
next_steps: Apply to Y Combinator (W26/S26) for institutional validation
Pilot kiryana partnerships (3-5 stores) with $10-15K founder capital
Approach strategic partners (InDrive, Yango) for partnership-first model
Build toward profitability in single neighborhood before Series A
Pursue Pakistan VC seed ($500K-$1M) after demonstrating traction

limitations: Careem $400M mega-round (97% of capital) distorts metrics
Pakistan-specific allocation undisclosed for global funds (InDrive, Yango)
Foodpanda/Delivery Hero Pakistan capex estimated but not disclosed
Small sample size (4 rounds) creates outlier sensitivity
